article.headline: McNeese State 64, Nicholls State 49
article.story: LAKE CHARLES, La. (AP) -- McNeese State ran up an early lead and then fought back a late Nicholls State rally for a 64-59 victory Thursday. Ryan Price and J. T. Williams led a second half attack for the Cowboys (9-7, 4-1 Southland) that they had to run without starting point guard Dwight Boatner. Boatner, who had scored eight points in the first half, was elbowed in the head in the second half warmups and went out with a concussion. Both Price and Williams finished the night with a team high 14 points, Price scoring eight of his in the second half. Adonis Gray led the Colonels (7-9, 3-2) with 17 points, while Stefan Blaszczynski tossed in 15. In the second half, Nicholls made a 14-6 run to catch the Cowboys at 46-46 with 11:59 left. The lead then changed hands five times and was tied twice before McNeese went up for good at 57-54 on a 3-pointer from Williams. Price then scored four points, Williams made two and Jon Ford capped off the scoring for the Cowboys by making the final two points at the free throw line.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
